##Score Differences Between All Pairs of Timepoints 
#####Statistically reliable change is indicated by ** 
```{r, echo = FALSE, warning = FALSE,comment=NA, message=FALSE}

if(length(Entered_Scores_Df$Date) == 2) {  

Rep_Df<- Entered_Scores_Df
      if(Rep_Df$Score[2] > Rep_Df$CI_Upper_Lim[1] | Rep_Df$Score[2] < Rep_Df$CI_Lower_Lim[1]) {
        SigChange2<- paste(Rep_Df$Change[2], "**")
      } else if(Rep_Df$Score[2] < Rep_Df$CI_Upper_Lim[1] & Rep_Df$Score[2] > Rep_Df$CI_Lower_Lim[1]) {
        SigChange2<- paste(Rep_Df$Change[2])
      }
      
      Time1<- paste0(Rep_Df$Date[1])
      Change_Rep_Df2<- data.frame(Time1, SigChange2)
      names(Change_Rep_Df2)[2]<- paste0(Rep_Df$Date[2])  
  

kable(Change_Rep_Df2, booktabs = T, format = "latex") %>% kable_styling(position = "left", full_width = F) %>% row_spec(0, bold = T) %>% column_spec(1, bold = T)
  
} 
```

      } else if(Rep_Df$Score_Effects_Symptoms[4] < Rep_Df$CI_Upper_Lim_Effects_Symptoms[3] & Rep_Df$Score_Effects_Symptoms[4] > Rep_Df$CI_Lower_Lim_Effects_Symptoms[3]) {
        SigChange5d_Effects_Symptoms<- paste(Rep_Df$Change_Effects_Symptoms[4])
      }
      
      if(Rep_Df$Score_Effects_Symptoms[5] > Rep_Df$CI_Upper_Lim_Effects_Symptoms[3] | Rep_Df$Score_Effects_Symptoms[5] < Rep_Df$CI_Lower_Lim_Effects_Symptoms[3]) {
        SigChange5e_Effects_Symptoms<- paste((Rep_Df$Score_Effects_Symptoms[5] - Rep_Df$Score_Effects_Symptoms[3]), "**")
      } else if(Rep_Df$Score_Effects_Symptoms[5] < Rep_Df$CI_Upper_Lim_Effects_Symptoms[3] & Rep_Df$Score_Effects_Symptoms[5] > Rep_Df$CI_Lower_Lim_Effects_Symptoms[3]) {
        SigChange5e_Effects_Symptoms<- paste((Rep_Df$Score_Effects_Symptoms[5] - Rep_Df$Score_Effects_Symptoms[3]))
      }
      
      
      Time3<- paste0(Rep_Df$Date[3])
      Change_Rep_Df5b_Effects_Symptoms<- data.frame(Time3, SigChange5d_Effects_Symptoms, SigChange5e_Effects_Symptoms)
      names(Change_Rep_Df5b_Effects_Symptoms)[2]<- paste0(Rep_Df$Date[4])  
      names(Change_Rep_Df5b_Effects_Symptoms)[3]<- paste0(Rep_Df$Date[5])    
  
kable(Change_Rep_Df5b_Effects_Symptoms, booktabs = T, format = "latex") %>% kable_styling(position = "left", full_width = F) %>% row_spec(0, bold = T) %>% column_spec(1, bold = T)
}

\begingroup\Large

\begin{center} \textbf{Information about the Illness Attitude Scales (IAS)} \end{center} 

#What it Measures: 

* Psychopathology and illness behaviour related to hypochondriasis. 

* Includes 9 subscales, which assess: **(1) Worry about Illness**, **(2) Concerns about Pain**, **(3) Health Habits**, **(4) Hypochondriacal Beliefs**, **(5) Thanatophobia (fear of death)**, **(6) Disease Phobia**, **(7) Bodily Preoccupations** (fixation on bodily symptoms), **(8) Treatment Experience** (frequency/degree of treatment seeking) and &&(9) Effect of Symptoms** (psychosocial impact of bodily symptoms). 


#What Higher Scores Mean:

* More severe psychological disturbance and maladaptive behaviour associated with health anxiety. 

* Greater likelihood of meeting criteria for Illness Anxiety Disorder or another somatoform disorder. 


#Scale Quality:

* Reviews have provided strong support for the IAS when compared to other measures of health anxiety, and this scale has higher test-retest reliability than the Whitely Index (Hedman, Lekander, Ljtsson, Lindefors, Rck et al., 2015; Hfling & Weck, 2013). 


#Scale Structure:

* 27 items

* 5-point Likert scale

* For all items (except those forming the Health Habits subscale), respondents are asked to indicate how frequently ("No" = 0; "Most of the time" = 4) each statement is currently true for them (e.g. "Do you examine your body to find whether there is something wrong?"). 

* A number of studies have failed to replicate the original 9-factor structure proposed by the scale developer. Instead, 2-factor (Hiller & Rief, 2002), 3-factor (Weck, Bleichardt & Hiller, 2009), and 4-factor (Crssman & Pauli, 2006) solutions have been proposed for use with different populations. Therefore, while individual subscales may have clinical utility, be cautious in interpreting them.

\endgroup
